results.title: Some babies die
results.brief_description: An exploration of stillbirth and neonatal grief by sharing the experience of two families. One family, under the guidance of a specialised medical team, undergoes an unusual counselling process to help them resolve their grief more easily. They are encouraged to spend time seeing, holding and touching their dead baby. This is a film which questions our attitudes on death.

results.title: Some Australian birds
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, CSIRO and S.T. Evans
results.brief_description: The work of the wild life survey section of the CSIRO. Includes close study of the function of the lyrebird’s mimicry; the nesting habits of the mallee fowl, a shy bird which builds a high mound; the king penguin which lives on Macquarie Island in large colonies, and the Tasmanian mutton birds which support a small industry.

results.title: Somazone (MAC & PC)
results.creator_credit: Cinemedia, Human Services, Quit, Legal Aid Commission of Victoria, National Asthma Campaign, Electric Alchemy, Tom Olsson and Richard Jones
results.brief_description: SomaZone is about exploring, experimenting and making choices. It’s a “Life-Simulator” which gives teenagers a chance for real decision-making. By creating a “personal body”, users can take risks and see what happens. SomaZone is a multimedia package designed to look at health, society and the law from the perspective of adolescents. Discussion notes are included in the CD in WORD format. Technical requirements: Will run on PC and MAC. PC’s need Windows 3.1 or later; 486 - 66 CPU; 6MB of free RAM; 2 x CD-ROM drive; SVGA (256 colours); 16 bit Soundblaster or compatible; Quicktime for Windows 2.1.2 (supplied). Macintosh: System 7 or later; 030 - 30MHz; 6 MB of free Ram; 2 x CD-ROM drive; 256 colours; Quicktime 2.5 supplied.

results.title: Solutions to pollution
results.brief_description: An introduction to some possible solutions to air, water, and noise pollution. Stresses conservation of resources, particularly at community level. Could be used to stimulate further in-depth discussion on some of the answers it provides. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Solutions
results.brief_description: Examples of the price we pay in our deteriorating environment for the misuse of road traffic. In contrast we see the modern railway system offering an already existing solution to our crowded island’s transport problems. A film without commentary.

results.title: Solomon and Gaenor
results.creator_credit: Sianel 4 Cymru (S4C) (Channel 4 Wales), APT Film and Television, Sheryl Crown and Paul Morrison
results.brief_description: Set against the Tredegar riots against Jewish shops in 1911, “Solomon and Gaenor” is a tragic love story of Jewish cloth merchant, Solomon (Ioan Gruffudd), and Gaenor (Nia Roberts), daughter of a struggling Welsh mining family. Solomon keeps his Jewish heritage a secret from his new love, who becomes frustrated by his inability to settle down and marry, and for the unspoken secrets between them. They are forced to re-evaluate their relationship when Gaenor falls pregnant and tensions mount between striking Welsh miners and Jewish storeholders, placing Solomon’s family in the front line. Director Paul Morrison asserts that the film is principally about the universal notion that we hide aspects of ourselves from those we love. He also manages to capture a painful chapter in the British Jewish experience. Cast also includes Sue Jones Davies, William Thomas and Mark Jones. In Welsh, Hebrew and English with English subtitles.
